lead_paragraph: A new requirement, which follows a 2014 executive order affecting federal contractors, calls for companies with 100 employees or more to report pay by race, gender and ethnicity.

headline.print_headline: Obama Seeks to Expand Rules Targeting Gender Salary Gap
headline.main: Obama Moves to Expand Rules Aimed at Closing Gender Pay Gap

snippet: A new requirement, which follows a 2014 executive order affecting federal contractors, calls for companies with 100 employees or more to report pay by race, gender and ethnicity.
abstract: Pres Obama announces proposal to mandate companies report to government what they pay employees, broken down by race, gender and ethnicity, part of effort to address salary gap between men and women; rules will be issued by executive order, and announcement comes on seventh anniversary of signing of Lily Ledbetter Fair Pay Act.
